intro: Polygonum serrulatum var. salicifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf smartweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It features lanceolate to narrowly ovate leaves with serrated edges, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red, arranged in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist to wet habitats such as wetlands, marshes, and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species in ecological studies and wetland restoration projects.
